articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel has received a shipment of heavy MK-84 bombs from the United States, after U.S. President Donald Trump lifted a block imposed on the export of the munitions by the administration of predecessor Joe Biden, the defence ministry said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel receives shipment of heavy bombs cleared by Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces sharply increased combat activity in eastern Ukraine on Saturday and the main attacks were concentrated near an important logistic hub of Pokrovsk, Ukrainian military said on Sunday.
articles.title: Russians troops sharply stepped up attacks on Ukrainian forces on Saturday, military says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: European countries will not create one unified army in response to threats from Russia, Polish Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski said in an interview with state TV broadcast late on Saturday.
articles.title: European countries will not create one united army, says Poland's Sikorski

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. State Department has removed a statement on its website that it does not support Taiwan independence, among changes that the island's government praised on Sunday as supporting Taiwan.
articles.title: US drops website wording on not supporting Taiwan independence

articles.author: Mayank Bhardwaj
articles.description: The death toll in a stampede at the main railway station in India's capital New Delhi rose to at least 18, including five children, media reports said on Sunday, citing the Press Trust of India news agency.
articles.title: Death toll rises to at least 18 in New Delhi railway station stampede

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israeli hostages Iair Horn, Sagui Dekel-Chen and Sasha (Alexander) Troufanov arrived at a release site in Gaza on Saturday after Egyptian and Qatari mediators helped avert a standoff that threatened to sink a fragile ceasefire.
articles.title: Three Israeli hostages set to return from Gaza as ceasefire holds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis, who is receiving treatment for a respiratory tract infection, had a peaceful night in hospital, Italy's ANSA news agency reported on Sunday.
articles.title: Pope has second peaceful night in hospital - ANSA

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least one person was injured in Russian overnight air attacks that also started a fire in a critical infrastructure building in the southern city of Mykolaiv and damaged several houses in the Kyiv region, Ukrainian officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Russian overnight attacks injure one, damage infrastructure, houses, Ukraine officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Forty-three people, mostly women, were killed after an artisanal gold mine collapsed in western Mali on Saturday, the head of an industry union said.
articles.title: Over 40 people killed in Mali mine collapse

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hezbollah on Sunday condemned an attack on a United Nations Interim Force (UNIFIL) convoy in Beirut on Friday which UNIFIL said had injured the force's outgoing deputy commander.
articles.title: Hezbollah condemns attack on UNIFIL convoy in Beirut
